description:
I use nova revision 1204 with XenServer 5.6.

When I start an instance with OSAPI, I specified the parameter '--file' to inject this file on the file system of the instance: 'nova boot --image 64 --file /root/=/root/tmp.sh --flavor 2 "VM XenServer Ubuntu server"'

The instance start correctly but the file wasn't inject on its file system. Few seconds (30s) after booting, I saw this log error in 'nova-compute':

2011-06-23 18:30:55,231 WARNING nova.virt.xenapi [-] Task [Async.host.call_plugin] OpaqueRef:07b68cee-9833-48e2-75f7-520e4cd60a4a status: failure    ['XENAPI
_PLUGIN_EXCEPTION', 'version', 'PluginError', 'TIMEOUT: No response from agent within 30 seconds.']
2011-06-23 18:30:55,333 ERROR nova.virt.xenapi.vmops [-] TIMEOUT: The call to version timed out. VM id=94; args={'path': '', 'dom_id': '35', 'id': '83dcee39-
455a-4124-9280-a19e0f1175f9'}
2011-06-23 18:30:55,333 INFO nova.virt.xenapi.vmops [-] No agent version returned by instance
2011-06-23 18:30:55,333 DEBUG nova.virt.xenapi.vmops [-] Injecting file path: '/root/' from (pid=16035) _inject_files /usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/nova/virt/xenapi/vmops.py:278
2011-06-23 18:30:55,671 WARNING nova.virt.xenapi [-] Task [Async.host.call_plugin] OpaqueRef:7c58bc24-8ece-390f-c3af-a2e0c29d94b5 status: failure    ['XENAPI
_PLUGIN_EXCEPTION', 'inject_file', 'KeyError', "'b64_file'"]
2011-06-23 18:30:55,772 ERROR nova.virt.xenapi.vmops [-] The call to inject_file returned an error: ['XENAPI_PLUGIN_EXCEPTION', 'inject_file', 'KeyError', "'
b64_file'"]. VM id=94; args={'path': '', 'dom_id': '35', 'id': '79fdffc6-a58c-4409-94aa-02c7479f8158', 'b64_path': 'L3Jvb3Qv', 'b64_contents': 'WU8K'}
2011-06-23 18:30:55,772 WARNING nova.virt.xenapi.vmops [-] expected string or buffer
2011-06-23 18:30:55,772 ERROR nova.virt.xenapi.vmops [-] Instance instance-0000005e: failed to boot
(nova.virt.xenapi.vmops): TRACE: Traceback (most recent call last):
(nova.virt.xenapi.vmops): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/nova/virt/xenapi/vmops.py", line 299, in _wait_for_boot
(nova.virt.xenapi.vmops): TRACE:     _inject_files()
(nova.virt.xenapi.vmops): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/nova/virt/xenapi/vmops.py", line 279, in _inject_files
(nova.virt.xenapi.vmops): TRACE:     self.inject_file(instance, path, contents)
(nova.virt.xenapi.vmops): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/nova/virt/xenapi/vmops.py", line 599, in inject_file
(nova.virt.xenapi.vmops): TRACE:     resp_dict = json.loads(resp)
(nova.virt.xenapi.vmops): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/python2.6/json/__init__.py", line 307, in loads
(nova.virt.xenapi.vmops): TRACE:     return _default_decoder.decode(s)
(nova.virt.xenapi.vmops): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/python2.6/json/decoder.py", line 319, in decode
(nova.virt.xenapi.vmops): TRACE:     obj, end = self.raw_decode(s, idx=_w(s, 0).end())
(nova.virt.xenapi.vmops): TRACE: TypeError: expected string or buffer
(nova.virt.xenapi.vmops): TRACE:
title: XenServer file inject fails

comments.content:
I use nova revision 1204 with XenServer 5.6.

When I start an instance with OSAPI, I specified the parameter '--file' to inject this file on the file system of the instance: 'nova boot --image 64 --file /root/=/root/tmp.sh --flavor 2 "VM XenServer Ubuntu server"'

The instance start correctly but the file wasn't inject on its file system. Few seconds (30s) after booting, I saw this log error in 'nova-compute':

2011-06-23 18:30:55,231 WARNING nova.virt.xenapi [-] Task [Async.host.call_plugin] OpaqueRef:07b68cee-9833-48e2-75f7-520e4cd60a4a status: failure    ['XENAPI
_PLUGIN_EXCEPTION', 'version', 'PluginError', 'TIMEOUT: No response from agent within 30 seconds.']
2011-06-23 18:30:55,333 ERROR nova.virt.xenapi.vmops [-] TIMEOUT: The call to version timed out. VM id=94; args={'path': '', 'dom_id': '35', 'id': '83dcee39-
455a-4124-9280-a19e0f1175f9'}
2011-06-23 18:30:55,333 INFO nova.virt.xenapi.vmops [-] No agent version returned by instance
2011-06-23 18:30:55,333 DEBUG nova.virt.xenapi.vmops [-] Injecting file path: '/root/' from (pid=16035) _inject_files /usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/nova/virt/xenapi/vmops.py:278
2011-06-23 18:30:55,671 WARNING nova.virt.xenapi [-] Task [Async.host.call_plugin] OpaqueRef:7c58bc24-8ece-390f-c3af-a2e0c29d94b5 status: failure    ['XENAPI
_PLUGIN_EXCEPTION', 'inject_file', 'KeyError', "'b64_file'"]
2011-06-23 18:30:55,772 ERROR nova.virt.xenapi.vmops [-] The call to inject_file returned an error: ['XENAPI_PLUGIN_EXCEPTION', 'inject_file', 'KeyError', "'
b64_file'"]. VM id=94; args={'path': '', 'dom_id': '35', 'id': '79fdffc6-a58c-4409-94aa-02c7479f8158', 'b64_path': 'L3Jvb3Qv', 'b64_contents': 'WU8K'}
2011-06-23 18:30:55,772 WARNING nova.virt.xenapi.vmops [-] expected string or buffer
2011-06-23 18:30:55,772 ERROR nova.virt.xenapi.vmops [-] Instance instance-0000005e: failed to boot
(nova.virt.xenapi.vmops): TRACE: Traceback (most recent call last):
(nova.virt.xenapi.vmops): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/nova/virt/xenapi/vmops.py", line 299, in _wait_for_boot
(nova.virt.xenapi.vmops): TRACE:     _inject_files()
(nova.virt.xenapi.vmops): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/nova/virt/xenapi/vmops.py", line 279, in _inject_files
(nova.virt.xenapi.vmops): TRACE:     self.inject_file(instance, path, contents)
(nova.virt.xenapi.vmops): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/nova/virt/xenapi/vmops.py", line 599, in inject_file
(nova.virt.xenapi.vmops): TRACE:     resp_dict = json.loads(resp)
(nova.virt.xenapi.vmops): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/python2.6/json/__init__.py", line 307, in loads
(nova.virt.xenapi.vmops): TRACE:     return _default_decoder.decode(s)
(nova.virt.xenapi.vmops): TRACE:   File "/usr/lib/python2.6/json/decoder.py", line 319, in decode
(nova.virt.xenapi.vmops): TRACE:     obj, end = self.raw_decode(s, idx=_w(s, 0).end())
(nova.virt.xenapi.vmops): TRACE: TypeError: expected string or buffer
(nova.virt.xenapi.vmops): TRACE:
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ethuleau

comments.content: XenServer file injection relies on the use of a guest agent apparently... The error you get first points to a missing agent (or an agent that cannot be contacted). Do you use an agent in your vm ?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx

comments.content:
What do you mean by agent ? Is it a specific agent for OpenStack ?
I install the xs-tool and set the boot parameter for PV driver.
On my VM OS, a daemon named "xe-daemon" is running. Is it enough ?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ethuleau

comments.content:
I'm not the XenServer resident expert, but Rackspace uses a specific guest agent to act on VMs. The agent code is at https://launchpad.net/agent-smith

Hopefully one of the authors will comment here.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx

comments.content:
Hi Thierry,

I believe the most recent agent codebase can be found here:

https://launchpad.net/openstack-guest-agents

I recently learned agent smith is the old project ( perhaps we should retire it? )

--

Also, I think at some point in the future the project may split out the Windows and Linux clients into separate source trees.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~dan-prince

comments.content:
I didn't had time to test but I think it will resolve my problem.
I put the bug to invalid.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ethuleau
